title: Lauren E. Flynn
text: I am a current PhD student in the Educational Psychology department at the University of Minnesota. Her research explores the dynamics of language, examining the many contextual factors that shape student discourses such as online cognitive and comprehension processes, writing content, and educational interactions.

title: About
text:
My overarching research interest relates to the dynamics of discourse‚Äì how different aspects of language fluctuate over time. Basically, much of my research examines how linguistic properties in text or spoken discourse change across time.
Examples of discourse contexts I‚Äôve researched: groupchats between students in an ed tech platform, lyrics, Trader Joe‚Äôs product reviews, books from Project Gutenberg, movie script dialogues, subreddit discussion, reflective/informal writing, interactions between strangers over Zoom, think-alouds produced during reading, and March Madness press conference transcripts
Examples of linguistic features I‚Äôve examined: sentiment, cohesion, swearing, reflection/metacognition, sourcing, topics/semantic spaces, academic language, bursts/pauses in keystrokes, gendered language, turn-taking
